intro: Geniostoma haemospermum var. erosum, commonly known as the bloodseed plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red or purple seeds that resemble blood, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. The botanical interest of this species lies in its unique seed morphology and its role in traditional medicine in some regions.
